title: Stormy conditions leave thousands stranded at Burning Man Festival
description: The festival organizers are preventing access to and from Nevada's Black Rock Desert where the annual event takes place after nearly an inch of rainfall created mud-bath-like conditions.

title: During post-storm tour, Biden praises Florida residents for their 'remarkable' spirit
description: The president visited the city of Live Oak in northern Florida, about an hour northeast of where Hurricane Idalia made landfall earlier this week.

title: Bill Richardson, former New Mexico governor and diplomat, dies at 75
description: Richardson, who previously served as U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, died in his sleep at his home in Chatham, Mass., the Richardson Center for Global Engagement said on Saturday.

title: Foundation pulls invite to Russia, Belarus and Iran to attend Nobel Prize ceremonies
description: Swedish lawmakers had said they would boycott this year's Nobel Prize ceremonies in Stockholm after the foundation invited representatives of the three countries to attend.

title: Jimmy Buffett, who sang of wastin' away in 'Margaritaville', dies at 76
description: The singer-songwriter, who popularized beach bum soft rock with the escapist song and turned that celebration of loafing into an empire of restaurants, resorts and frozen concoctions, has died.

title: Whatever happened to the Ukrainian refugees who found a haven in Brazil?
description: After fleeing the war in Ukraine, a family found a sense of belonging far away - in Prudentópolis, Brazil, known as "Little Ukraine." A year later, the family finds themselves starting over yet again.

title: Imprisoned for abortion: Many Rwandan women are now free but stigma remains
description: They were sentenced for up to 10 years for violating anti-abortion laws. Some say their pregnancy was a result of rape. Rwanda has now liberalized its abortion laws and pardoned hundreds of the women.

title: Women's gymnastics is changing in more ways than one
description: What had once been a sport associated largely with white girls is increasingly dominated by women of color. And more elite gymnasts are competing in the NCAA while they go for the gold.

title: Inside the making of 'Starfield' — one of the biggest stories ever told
description: Starfield's story shoots for the stars. How much players like it will have big consequences here on Earth.

title: At risk from rising seas, Norfolk, Virginia, plans massive, controversial floodwall
description: Critics say the $2.6 billion floodwall project overlooks current climate risks and exposes flaws in how the federal government approaches major flood infrastructure.

title: See how Trump's trials crowd the Republican political calendar
description: To see the extent to which the Republican political calendar and Donald Trump's legal calendar are intertwined, it's helpful to see them laid out together.

title: Voting in North Carolina faces some big changes with a Republican-backed bill
description: Major changes are likely coming to North Carolina's voting rules. A bill would eliminate a three-day grace period for counting mail ballots and expand access for partisan poll watchers.

title: Labor Day is now a key to Election Day for Democrats and Republicans alike
description: With all that has shifted around in American politics, the Democrats' disconnect from the broad working class is the loss that has cost them the most and threatens them most in the years ahead.

title: Biden is touring Hurricane Idalia damage. But DeSantis doesn't have plans to meet him
description: President Biden had said he would meet with Gov. Ron DeSantis during a tour of hurricane damage on Saturday. But on Friday night, the governor's office threw cold water on the idea.

title: A Texas law requiring age verification on porn sites is unconstitutional, judge rules
description: A federal judge said the latest state law to require age verification on adult websites doesn't serve its purported purpose: protecting minors from viewing sexually explicit content.
